Description: Persistent site identifier that is unique across the East River Community Observatory. Typically this is a two-letter code AA. In some cases the location identifer from another reference was used, where they were not marked as two-letter codes. Drainages are all two letter codes and are used as prefix for point and plot location identifiers.
A location name that is more commonly used. Location names are not necessarily unique, can change over time, and should not be solely used to identify sites.
Indicate if it is a region or sub-region.
This is used to construct the location hierarchy, and should be either another region/sub-region that the location is a part of.
A brief description of the region.
